what: An R package with Tools for Longevity Partners Employees

title: An R package with Tools for Longevity Partners Employees
text: can install development version mrworthingtonR Github :

title: An R package with Tools for Longevity Partners Employees
text: basic example shows solve common problem:
code: library(mrworthingtonR) library(ggplot2)  ggplot(mpg) +   aes(x = displ, y = hwy, colour = class) +   geom_point() +   theme_mrw(legend_position = "bottom") +   labs(title = "This is the title",        subtitle = "This is a compelling subtitle",        caption = "Where We Got The Data From")

title: Add A Logo — add_logo
text: Add Logo

title: Add A Logo — add_logo
Add A Logo — add_logo
text: ggplot name ggplot object want logo logo_path file path logo. Must PNG file.

title: Add A Logo — add_logo
text: patchwork object

title: Add A Logo — add_logo
code: if (FALSE) { library(mrworthingtonR) library(ggplot2)  my_chart <- ggplot(mpg) +   aes(x = displ, y = hwy, colour = class) +   geom_point() +   theme_mrw(legend_position = "none") +   labs(title = "This is the title",        subtitle = "This is a compelling subtitle",        caption = "Where We Got The Data From") logo_chart <- add_logo(my_chart)  logo_chart }

what: Longitudinal Database of Texas Charter School Enrollment + Financials. — charter_data
title: Longitudinal Database of Texas Charter School Enrollment + Financials. — charter_data
text: dataset built using two datasets Texas Education Agency (TEA). One source Public Education Information Management System (PEIMS) Single File Financial Data Downloads, contains links Charter School Actual Financials Data SY1999-2000 SY2020-2021. dataset 2007-2021 Summarized PEIMS Actual Financial Data, contains actual financial data school districts (ISDs, Military ISDs, + Charters) 2006-2007 2020-2021. individual years charter actual financial datasets used identify charters school year. cross linked broader summarized PEIMS actual financials.

title: Longitudinal Database of Texas Charter School Enrollment + Financials. — charter_data
Longitudinal Database of Texas Charter School Enrollment + Financials. — charter_data
text: tibble 9,161 rows 13 variables: year year end school year. example, 2021 refers SY2020-2021. cmo_class Classification Major CMOs. See note CMO classification. dist_count n value districts represented aggregate calculation. fall_enrollment aggregate fall enrollment value CMO class. fund_name fund name recorded Texas Education Agency amt_total aggregated fund name's total amount. amt_per_pupil aggregated fund name's total amount, per pupil. amt_dist aggregated fund name's total amount, per n value dist_count.

title: Longitudinal Database of Texas Charter School Enrollment + Financials. — charter_data
text: Public Education Information Management System (PEIMS) Single File Financial Data Downloads: page provides information links regarding Public Education Information Management System (PEIMS) budget actual financial data. single data (.csv) files need imported database can handle approximately 985,000 rows data . Older versions Microsoft Excel size limitations approximately 65,000 rows.). TEA's Summarized PEIMS Actual Financial Data, 2007-2021: Excel spreadsheet (.xlsx) PEIMS actual financial data 2006-2007 2020-2021.

title: Longitudinal Database of Texas Charter School Enrollment + Financials. — charter_data
text: CMO Classification done based current year enrollment counts. Charter Management Organizations (CMOs) enrollments greater 10,000 classified. Charters less 10,000 labeled "Non-Major CMOs". n values included summary aggregates dist_count column.

what: Get Historic Basic Allotment Data — get_ba
title: Get Historic Basic Allotment Data — get_ba
text: basic allotment legislatively mandated apportionment funds general revenue funds goes school district provide basic level education district’s residents. data based recorded data found following PDF provided Texas Education Agency. represents annual basic allotment figures school year, starting 2010.

title: Get Historic Basic Allotment Data — get_ba
Get Historic Basic Allotment Data — get_ba
text: Basic Allotment Explainer, Texas Education Agency. State Funding Division, (512) 463-9238 sfinance@tea.texas.gov

title: Get Historic Basic Allotment Data — get_ba
text: tbl_df object

title: Get Historic Basic Allotment Data — get_ba
code: library(mrworthingtonR) library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: ‘dplyr’ #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:stats’: #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’: #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union ba_df <- get_ba() |>   glimpse() #> Rows: 13 #> Columns: 2 #> $ year            <chr> "2010", "2011", "2012", "2013", "2014", "2015", "2016"… #> $ basic_allotment <dbl> 4765, 4765, 4765, 4765, 4950, 5040, 5140, 5140, 5140, …

what: Get Inflation Data from the Bureau of Labor Statistics — get_inflation
title: Get Inflation Data from the Bureau of Labor Statistics — get_inflation
text: Get Inflation Data Bureau Labor Statistics

title: Get Inflation Data from the Bureau of Labor Statistics — get_inflation
Get Inflation Data from the Bureau of Labor Statistics — get_inflation
text: index index want pull Bureau Labor Statistics. Options "cpi" Consumers Price Index "edu" education + communication index. Default CPI.

title: Get Inflation Data from the Bureau of Labor Statistics — get_inflation
text: tbl_df object

title: Get Inflation Data from the Bureau of Labor Statistics — get_inflation
code: library(mrworthingtonR) library(dplyr)  cpi_raw <- get_inflation("cpi") |>   filter(series_id == "CUSR0000SA0") |>   select(year, period, cpi_value=value) #> Rows: 60445 Columns: 5 #> ── Column specification ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Delimiter: "\t" #> chr (3): series_id        , period,        value #> dbl (1): year #> lgl (1): footnote_codes #>  #> ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data. #> ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.  glimpse(cpi_raw) #> Rows: 913 #> Columns: 3 #> $ year      <chr> "1947", "1947", "1947", "1947", "1947", "1947", "1947", "194… #> $ period    <chr> "M01", "M02", "M03", "M04", "M05", "M06", "M07", "M08", "M09… #> $ cpi_value <dbl> 21.48, 21.62, 22.00, 22.00, 21.95, 22.08, 22.23, 22.40, 22.8…  edu_raw <- get_inflation("edu") |>   filter(series_id == "CUSR0000SAE1") |>   select(year, period, ed_value=value) #> Rows: 18726 Columns: 5 #> ── Column specification ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Delimiter: "\t" #> chr (3): series_id        , period,        value #> dbl (1): year #> lgl (1): footnote_codes #>  #> ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data. #> ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.  glimpse(edu_raw) #> Rows: 361 #> Columns: 3 #> $ year     <chr> "1993", "1993", "1993", "1993", "1993", "1993", "1993", "1993… #> $ period   <chr> "M01", "M02", "M03", "M04", "M05", "M06", "M07", "M08", "M09"… #> $ ed_value <dbl> 76.1, 76.5, 77.0, 77.4, 77.8, 78.3, 78.7, 79.1, 79.5, 79.9, 8…

Import Figtree font for use with ggplot2 Charts — import_figtree
text: option mrworthington.loadfonts -- set TRUE -- call extrafont::loadfonts() register non-core fonts R PDF & PostScript devices. running Windows, package calls function register non-core fonts Windows graphics device.

title: Import Figtree font for use with ggplot2 Charts — import_figtree
text: take care ensuring PDF/PostScript usage. location font directory displayed base import complete. highly recommended install system way font wish use programs.

what: Longitudinal Database of Texas School District Property Values and Tax Rates. — tea_isd_tax_data
title: Longitudinal Database of Texas School District Property Values and Tax Rates. — tea_isd_tax_data
text: dataset comes Texas Education Agency (TEA). includes data recorded bottom ISD's Public Education Information Management System (PEIMS) Financial Actual Reports.

title: Longitudinal Database of Texas School District Property Values and Tax Rates. — tea_isd_tax_data
Longitudinal Database of Texas School District Property Values and Tax Rates. — tea_isd_tax_data
text: tibble 9,161 rows 13 variables: year year end school year. example, 2013 refers SY2012-2013. dist_id District ID Assigned Texas Education Agency dist_name District Name Recognized Texas Education Agency m_o_tax_rate Maintenance & Operations (M&O) Tax Rate year end recorded. i_s_tax_rate Interest & Sinking (&S) Tax Rate year end recorded. total_tax_rate Total Tax Rate (M&O + &S) year end recorded. total_property_value year end's Certified Total Property Values Used TEA total_property_value_per_pupil year end's Certified Total Property Values Used TEA, Per Pupil business_property_value year end's Certified Business Property Values Used TEA residential_property_value year end's Certified Residential Property Values Used TEA land_property_value year end's Certified Land Property Values Used TEA oil_and_gas_property_value year end's Certified Oil + Gas Property Values Used TEA other_property_value year end's Certified Property Values Used TEA

title: Longitudinal Database of Texas School District Property Values and Tax Rates. — tea_isd_tax_data
text: TEA's ISD Tax Rates State Certified Property Values Data Texas School Districts, SY2012-2013: ISD Tax Rates State Certified Property Values, via Texas Education Agency's Public Education Information Management System (PEIMS). title: Use ggplot2 Theme — theme_mrw
text: ggplot2 theme use .

title: Use ggplot2 Theme — theme_mrw
code: theme_mrw(   base_size = 14,   base_family = "",   title_size = 23,   subtitle_size = 12,   caption_size = 10,   legend_position = "none",   plot_title_position = "plot",   ... )

title: Use ggplot2 Theme — theme_mrw
text: base_size base size text plot base_family base font used generally across plot text title_size text size plot title subtitle_size text size plot subtitle caption_size text size plot caption legend_position legend placed plot_title_position position plot title (either "plot" "panel") ... Additional arguments passed ggplot2::theme_minimal()

title: Use ggplot2 Theme — theme_mrw
text: ggplot theme

title: Use ggplot2 Theme — theme_mrw
text: planning use "Figtree", download Google Fonts use locally use showtext package.

title: Use ggplot2 Theme — theme_mrw
code: library(mrworthingtonR) library(ggplot2)  ggplot(mpg) +   aes(x = displ, y = hwy, colour = class) +   geom_point() +   theme_mrw(legend_position = "bottom") +   labs(title = "This is the title",        subtitle = "This is a compelling subtitle",        caption = "Where We Got The Data From")

title: Use LP Brand Fonts — use_custom_fonts
text: Use LP Brand Fonts

title: Use LP Brand Fonts — use_custom_fonts
Use LP Brand Fonts — use_custom_fonts
text: enable enable use fonts

title: Use LP Brand Fonts — use_custom_fonts
code: if (FALSE) { library(mrworthingtonR) library(ggplot2) use_lp_fonts()  ggplot(mpg) +   aes(x = displ, y = hwy, colour = class) +   geom_point() +   theme_mrw(legend_position = "bottom", base_family = "Figtree") +   labs(title = "This is the title",        subtitle = "This is a compelling subtitle",        caption = "Where We Got The Data From") }

title: mrworthingtonR 0.0.1
text: theme_mrw() {ggplot2} theme adds basic styles ggplot() chart.
